posts.post_content: This is the best card in my soon-to-be-unproxied Eldrazi deck. It digs for what I want whenever I cast it, especially critical early game [Eldrazi Temple](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eldrazi Temple)s. And it will stay good when we head back to Mirrodin...

posts.post_content:
10/1/2009 Lands are colorless (even if their frames have some colored elements to them). You can't target a Swamp, a Mountain, or any other land with Celestial Purge (unless some other effect has turned that land black or red).  
  
In Legacy it'll lose out to crop rotation, but it's still good nonetheless. Get that land or that Jitte a few turns faster.
posts.html:

In Legacy it'll lose out to crop rotation, but it's still good nonetheless. Get that land or that Jitte a few turns faster.

posts.post_content:
I was looking for a card to put into a deck designed, in part, around [Liquimetal Coating](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liquimetal Coating). The ability to dig 5 cards deep for a single mana really ups the deck's potential as it *needs* that artifact. Even if [Liquimetal Coating](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liquimetal Coating) isnt in the 5 cards, it still lets me get a land and burn through my deck towards my key card.  
  
I will give this a 5 as it fits in a lot of decks that could use a card in that 1-mana-slot, and is a powerful yet balanced common.
posts.html:
I was looking for a card to put into a deck designed, in part, around Liquimetal Coating. The ability to dig 5 cards deep for a single mana really ups the deck's potential as it needs that artifact. Even if Liquimetal Coating isnt in the 5 cards, it still lets me get a land and burn through my deck towards my key card.

I will give this a 5 as it fits in a lot of decks that could use a card in that 1-mana-slot, and is a powerful yet balanced common.

Posted By: SweetZombiJesus (11/25/2010 9:47:37 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Im using this in my (future) deck with [Mycosynth Lattice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycosynth Lattice).   
With Mycosynth Lattice in play it becomes " 1: Look at the top 5 cards of your library. You may put 1 card into your hand. Put the remaining cards on the bottom of the library."  
Before Mycosynth Lattice is in play, you use it... to fetch the Mycosynth Lattice! Failing that, get a land or a [Liquimetal Coating](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liquimetal Coating). 5/5

Posted By: SeiberTross (3/21/2012 10:32:14 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
STANDARD: Awesome card to play when you are playing [Eldrazi Monument](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eldrazi Monument) in a [Mycoloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycoloth) and [Avenger of Zendikar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avenger of Zendikar) **green creature tokens deck**.
  
   
But this card is also very useful to get lands quickly in your hand (and to some extent very good in combination with [Explore](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Explore) or [Borderland Ranger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Borderland Ranger)). You will have your lands on table in no time to play your [Mycoloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycoloth) and [Avenger of Zendikar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avenger of Zendikar) on table.
posts.html:
STANDARD: Awesome card to play when you are playing Eldrazi Monument in a Mycoloth and Avenger of Zendikar green creature tokens deck.

But this card is also very useful to get lands quickly in your hand (and to some extent very good in combination with Explore or Borderland Ranger). You will have your lands on table in no time to play your Mycoloth and Avenger of Zendikar on table.

posts.post_content:
I underestimated this card until I suddenly realized it fetches lands.  
I was afraid it had a high chance of being a dead draw, but now I think I'm almost definitely putting this in my WUG defender deck, to grab some lands, one of my [Warmonger's Chariot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Warmonger's Chariot)s, or, if I get lucky, my [Eldrazi Conscription](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eldrazi Conscription).(why does it censor that?)  
I also wouldn't mind fetching a [Reinforced Bulwark](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reinforced Bulwark).
posts.html:

Posted By: fuzzyvision (1/5/2011 1:50:34 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Is this the mystery card that Tom LaPille was referring to for infect?? He said that the card doesn't pump creatures, and I don't think there are any other green cards in the block that could be classed as very useful to an infect deck, especially in a tournament setting.  
  
This could fetch you a [Contagion Clasp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Contagion Clasp) or [Contagion Engine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Contagion Engine), [Corpse Cur](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Corpse Cur), [Ichorclaw Myr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ichorclaw Myr), [Necropede](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necropede), one of the trigons, [Throne of Geth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Throne of Geth), [Vector Asp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vector Asp), as well as any other utility artifacts you are using.  
  
Failing that, it can still fetch you a land.
posts.html:

Failing that, it can still fetch you a land.
